definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: What most is exasperating , I order this model of new car, already suspended production at present.
sentences.chinese: 最氣人的是，我訂購的這款新車，目前已經停產。

sentences.english: The child is ill-bred, he annoys people with both his words and behavior.
sentences.chinese: 這孩子缺少家教，說話辦事特氣人。

sentences.english: And yet, after a few days’ stay, I found some things that were irritating.
sentences.chinese: 但是，呆了幾天以後，我發現一些氣人的事情。

sentences.english: His irritating ways are likely to mask deep psychological problems.
sentences.chinese: 他那些氣人的方式可能是在僞裝深層次的心理問題。

sentences.english: Waiting for the toilet was the most stressful queue, according to the survey.
sentences.chinese: 調查顯示，排隊上廁所是最氣人的。

sentences.english: Children can sometimes be very trying.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們有時也會很氣人的。

definition: to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
(dialect) hen/prostitute/(Tw) interfering/nosy/busybody (from Taiwanese 家婆, Tai-lo pr. [ke-pô])
lit. love the house and its crow (idiom); involvement with sb and everyone connected/Love me, love my dog.
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
angry words/sth said in the moment of anger
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
